meanings.sent1: The teacher will regrant extra credit for the assignment.
meanings.sent2: She decided to regrant permission for the student to leave early.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to regrant the disappearing act, but the audience saw the trick.
meanings.sent4: The artist will regrant life to the painting with a fresh coat of paint.
meanings.sent5: The chef will regrant flavor to the dish by adding more spices.

meanings.sent1: The regrant of the scholarship brought joy to the student.
meanings.sent2: The museum received a regrant to fund the new exhibit.
meanings.sent3: The regrant of the land surprised the community.
meanings.sent4: The company's regrant of funds helped support local businesses.
meanings.sent5: The regrant of the award boosted the artist's confidence.
